text: Thick aroma of coffee and malts, bitter coffee upfront with a full mouthfeel, coffee coats your teeth, bitter chocolate as an aftertaste, well done, tap.

On tap at RateBeer Best. Pours black with small tan head that diminishes to nothing. The aroma is roast, wood, smoke, cocoa. Medium body, dark chocolate, roasted malt, smoke, ash, wood, dry finish, very good.

Bottle shared by Esp0r at the Beer & Boardgames in the woods trip 2016. Black body ith a small brown head. Aroma of fresh coffee, chocolate, vanilla, earth. Bittersweet taste with a roasty edge, malty and solid in finish, nice bitter finish with a hoppy chocolate aftertaste. Very nice!

Opaque deep brown to black. Moderate beige head. Average lacing. Aroma: dark malts, coffee, cocoa. Light to medium body. Roasty taste. Additional coffee. Medium dry. Light citric & herbal bitterness. Well done. Still not my taste to be honest.
like iced coffee in a bottle...intense coffee and vanilla. initially syrupy with a bitter malt finish. not my taste, too sweet and too much vanilla, but perhaps someone elses cup of frapp
330ml bottle share thanks to Wingman. My lordies. Almost black colour with beige head. Nose is coffee and cocoa. Taste is a sweet mix of chocolate cocoa coffee beans. Beautiful

Bottle on train. Pours black with a solid dirty tan head that sticks around. Aroma is coffee, chocolate, vanilla, soy and a little marmite. Taste is a chocolate and coffee bomb with sweet vanilla finish and a little boozy burn. Really easy drinking. Lovely stuff
excellent beer? smelled just like a cup of mocca. chocolate, coffee, oatmeal, really smooth.

06.03.2017, 0,33l bottle @ home:
Nice light brown slightly bubbly-creamy mediumlasting head. Aroma is slightly rich and sour-ish roasted, dark malts, dark sugar, coffee, minerals, vanilla, grass, caramel, chocolate pudding, hints of bourbon. Taste is slightly dry sour-ish grassy, weeds, minerals, sour-ish roasted coffee, bark, grass, dark malts, hay, paper, medicine, harsh vanilla, hints of bourbon. Medium bitterness, slightly watery and sour-ish roasted mouthfeel. Nice aroma...

From tap at Ratebeer Best festival, Santa Rosa. Black color with brown head. Roasted malty aroma, chocolate, caramel, coffee, licorice, vanilla, spicy. sweet and bitter taste like aroma. Medium oily body with soft carbonation.
[1/28/17] Bottle/Draught at RateBeer Best festival in Santa Rosa. Black with a tan head. Chocolate, coffee, vanilla, roast. Sweetish, slightly sourish, bitterish. Medium to full-bodied.

0.33 l bottle from Etre Gourmet, bottled in August 2016. Black with a medium large, frothy, slowly diminishing, light brown head. Sweetish, malty, just slightly roasty aroma of coffee, milk chocolate, vanilla and hazelnut. Rather sweet, malty, slightly roasty taste of coffee, milk chocolate, hazelnut and lots of vanilla, followed by a medium long, moderately roasty-bitter, a bit dry finish. Medium body, almost creamy mouthfeel, soft carbonation. Tasty, very well-balanced as well, even if the coffee and the vanilla are easily noticeable.

Bottle, 33cL. Home. Kindly given @Jaghana ! Merci Pascal :) A shining pitch black beer with a medium beige foamy head ; medium retention. Black chocolate (++), roast, light toast, coffee (+), light herb, vanilla. Beautiful aromatic landscape. Medium dry bitter lasting refreshing, sweet note. Elegant body, light creamy texture, soft carbonation, dry chocolate refreshing finish. Overall, just delicious, a truely gourmet-beer, awesome !

Pour dark brown with tan head. Aroma of dark chocolate, some coffee and tons of vanilla. Flavour is the same with a dark chocolate backbone, lots of vanilla beans and little coffee (I expected way more to be honest). Soft carbonation and medium body. Nice stuff though.
Bottle at Maakuns place. Pours a black with a small beige head. Cocoa, roasty coffee, vanilla, chocolate. Medium sweet, medium bitter. Medium body, low carbonation.

Bottle shared. Dark brown with a small tan head. Aroma of coffee, vanilla, roast, dark chocolate, caramel and toffee. Flavour is above moderate sweet and moderate bitter. Medium bodied with soft carbonation.

Sampled from bottle at Maakuns. Thanks to kermis!! Black with tan head. Dark roasted chocolate malts, quite metallic, some dark fruitiness. Dark roasted coffee. Moderate sweet and moderate bitter. Medium body, silky feel. Soft carbonation. Nice roasty bittersweet finish.

Bottle shared thanks to kermis. Black with beige head. Cocoa, deep roasted fresh coffee, light citrus peel, ash, light coconut, soft cow dung, dried red berries. Medium sweet and bitter. Medium bodied.
Seriously disappointing considering the other reviews. Body was underwhelming, thin. Coffee flavour was burnt, slightly astringent. Buxton are normally better.

Schiuma moderata, grana fine, buona persistenza, di colore marrone.
Birra color nero e dallaroma di caffè in chicchi, macinato, fresco. Cioccolato fondente e polvere di cacao. In bocca è di corpo medio lamaro viene impartito dai malti tostati. Il caffè è meno presente rispetto allaroma, sbuca fuori il cacao e un retrogusto lungo, bruciato, piacevole e morbido. Ottimo esempio di coffee stout
Sample at RateBeer Best. Pours dark brown with a tan head. Aroma of coffee and roasted malt. Taste is coffee, vanilla, dark chocolate notes, dark malts.

Bottle, from minutemat-- thanks! Hearty, near-black pour with a bubbly brown head that retains as a thick pad. Huge fresh roast coffee aroma, underlying chocolate. The palate is very full bodied, with coffee and dark chocolate equally dominating, medium sweetness, with a welcome balancing acidity in the finish. Absolutely delicious and perfectly balanced.
user_location: the land of bitumen, beef & beer, Alberta, CANADA

text:
@RBB
Dark brown with a great coffee nose. The body and flavor are pleasant, but dont stand out like the aroma.
Bottle. Dark brown color. Very good aroma: fresh coffee, vanilla, caramel and halva. Taste: real chocolate with coffee and brandy, vanilla, sweet, caramel, dried fruit. Very tasty.
Bottle from Mane Liquor. Expecting great things. Didnt disappoint hugely but only delivered solidly. Just good all round, dry finish, very roasty with sweetness at length. Decent

Pours thick black with a small tan head.
Nose shows heavy coffee and roasted malt, slight nutty notes and a bit of toast.
Flavours include more heavy coffee, a bit of sweet liquourice-like notes, more toasty malt, and coffee-liqueur.

Piana beżowa, drobna, średnio trwała. Barwa ciemno brązowa. W aromacie bardzo przyjemna świeżo palona kawa, czekolada, odrobina słodyczy (może wanilii). W smaku półsłodkie, tu kakao i ciasto czekoladowe na pierwszym planie, kawa zaś stanowi tło, wanilia znów lekko podbija wrażenie słodkości. Goryczka nieduża, ziołowo palona, niskie do średniego wysycenie, dość pełne, owsiane w odbiorze.

Udany porter, zasłużone Top 50, dla mnie najważniejsze, że nie ma nut kwaśnych czy kwaskowatych od sporej ilości kawy, wyczuwalnej zarówno w aromacie jak i smaku (może laski wanilii tak na to wpłynęły?).
Heel veel vanille in de neus. Koffie in de smaak. Maar klinkt zeer chemisch-artificieel. Niet mijn ding.
Backlog, ocena przepisana z untappd, w ramach uzupełniania profilu na ratebeer. Łódź panel #23 Rewelacyjna kawa.
Svart med høyt lys brunt skum. Lukter skikkelig heftig av kaffe. Starter søtt, mørk sjokolade og kaffebitterhet kommer utover og holder lenge. Kaffelikør.

Marrom escuro quase negro, totalmente turva, espuma de cor creme densa, de ótima formação e persistente. Aroma de café torrado predominante, misturado com baunilha, caramelo, adocicada e complexa. Paladar de dulçor e amargor torrado de média intensidade, bem balanceada. Corpo denso e média carbonatação. Final persistente com torrado em evidência mas sempre mantendo um dulçor que equilibra a sensação do paladar.

Bottle. Sensoric. Pitch black with medium, light brown semi-thick head. Good head retention and lacing. Aroma is mainly rich mocha, milk chocolate and espresso notes. Also some light ashy and licorice notes. Medium body, oily and slick texture, finish is vanilla, mocha and chocolate. Summary: Very good brew. Mainly based on coffee and chocolate, but still with porter-like accents, just a little bit too sweet. ABV is well hidden. Very drinkable and worth trying.

My goodness. What a smooth, tasty and classy brew. I must get some to have in stock in my basement.Complete black color with a nice dense beige head. Good lacing. Looks inviting and fine. Lovely nice aroma with a fine intensity. Medium to full body and a smooth carbonation level. Easy to drink. Perfect balance between sweetness and bitterness. Solid smooth espresso coffee feeling in the flavor. Also some vanilla and roast. When the temperature changes, new flavor layers are popping up. Solid stuff. And dangerously well masked alcohol.[Bottle from Systembolaget in Sweden]

Bottle. Pours opaque black, small creamy tan head, nice residual and lacing. Aroma is rich mocha, espresso, hint of ashtray. Foodie is light sweet, light plus bitter, mocha goodness. Medium body, really silky mouthfeel. Excellent.
0,33l fles gedeeld met lion. Zwart met een creme kraag. Topper beetje vanille koffie en cacao heerlijk

Bottle. Pitch black color with tanned head. Aroma has coffee, vanilla, cocoa. Taste is malty sweet with long sweet and a little bitter aftertaste. Flavors of cocoa, vanilla, roasted malt, chocolate and dark fruits.

Bottle. Black with a fat coat of brown head that lasts quite well. 4- Cant smell much beer but there is plenty of mocha made with condensed milk and vanilla. A hint of alcohol too. 6+ Quite silky with low carbonation. Coffee doesnt dominate but you couldnt say its not prominent. Sweet, but not as sweet as suggested by the aroma. A moderate roasted malt character and some firm bitterness turn what threatened to be a bit sweet and flabby into something that works. Theres a slight chile note in the coffee which is nice too. Again, alcohol sticks out a little. Balance is a little too much in favour of the additions - particularly in the aroma - but its a pretty satisfying drop.
On tap at Omerta, Krakow, Poland. Small head, almost black. Very tasty , would drink again.

Bottle, bottled 19.08.2016 (from etre gourmet). Pours black with brown head. The head stays for some time. Aroma is mild, roast, coffee, vanilla, slight beaniness. Flavor is sweet and bitter, vanilla, coffee, chocolate, roast, malt. Finish is vanilla sweet with roast bitterness. Alcohol is well covered. Overall: very good, maybe a bit sweet.
Actually really dark to black for a Porter. 1 finger espresso head. smells nice. like a perfect everett clone. smooth creamy, great bitterness, lovely roast and coffee melded to gather. this is nice
dark brown colour, almost one inch dense beige head, which lasts for a few minutes, aroma and taste of mild roasted coffee, milk chocolate, some toffee and hints of vanilla; great porter!

UPDATED: DEC 27, 2016 Black beer, thinning brown head. Aroma of coffee, chocolate and malt. Coffee, malt, milk chocolate, some tangy fruit. It?s rich and creamy with an earthy, bittersweet aftertaste. Delicious.

Bottle from web SB cons 2016-12-25 Göteborg 
AR: heavy roasted coffee, Thai coffee sweets 
AP: black, high frothy thick brown lid
F: heavy roasted coffey, wee vanilla floral tone, chocolate with milk

Bottle 33cl.
@ LaBIRRAtorium, Madrid, Spain.
A: Black.
T: Roasted malt, coffee, chocolate.
How: bottle Appearance: black with a small brown head. Aroma: strong coffee scent, tart red berries, wood, brown sugar, grass. Palate: medium to full body, soft carbonation.

Bottle from ales by mail I think. Color is dark brown to black. Thin brown head. Medium bitterness, light sweetness. Medium body. Aroma and flavour is chocolate, roasted, liquorice, cacao, coffee, fruity, nutty. This is excellent!

Pours a close to black body with a very small, tan and short-lived head that disappears completely. Malty and strong aroma of coffee, dark roasted malt and milk chocolate, with dark caramel, fruits and dark berries in the back. Strong flavour of coffee, dark roasted malt, chocolate, dark caramel and vanilla, and a touch of ash. Moderate sweet taste with a long-lasting moderate bitter finish. Full-bodied, a delicious texture that is both creamy and dry, soft carbonation. Absolutely brilliant! 
[33 cl bottle, enjoyed 7 months after bottling, from Vinmonopolet Aker Brygge, Oslo]
Pours black with a medium tan head. Aroma is full of coffee with a hint of chocolate, smells great. Taste is more coffee with a small amount of vanilla coming through in the aftertaste.
Nästen svart öl med ett brunt skum. Doften är rostad, kaffe och malt. Även lättare inslag av choklad. Smaken är mindre rostad och sötare. Vanilj och choklad. Rostningen kommer tillbaka i eftersmaken.
Pours black with a beige head. Big Coffee aromas. Flavour is fresh roasted coffee with hints of chicory.

[Always eager to try new porters, only later realised that this one was among the 50 best ones in the RB listings!]
Bottle. Pours very dark chocolate to black, with a nice brown head. The appearance is that of a huge volume of espresso, I found it quite opaque. The aromas are dominated by coffee and cocoa, as expected, but especially with a dark chocolate one, with a very subtle tinge of fruitiness (esters?).Taste is that of unsweetened powdered cocoa, delicious rounded -toasted- bitterness just like a cold espresso, long lasting finish that fades away into a toasted malt background. Stunning. Medium to full body, easily full body, to be fair. Creamy texture and soft carbonation. What a beer. Further notes: coffee and cocoa are evidently additions to the porter itself, so while it is a very nice brew, it is still noticeably relying on coffee and cocoa for the aroma and taste... whether you like these beers or not, thats down to personal preference.

Bottle. Pitch black with a fading dark brown bubble head. Aroma is of coffee, dark chocolate, caramel, dark fruits. Taste is of coffee, roasted and sweet notes, chocolate, caramel, blackcurrant, figs, raisins, nuts. Sticky oily mouthfeel, medium carbonation.

Kolsvart, t?tt brunt skum av sm? bubblor. Doft: Kakao, tr?, pralin, vanilj, s?t ljus kola, lite rostat/lakrits, lera. Stark 7:a. Smak: Pralin, vanilj, s?tt svagt kaffe, ljus kola, rostat rasken grov, svagt av ren tobak, svagt av s?t lakrits.

On tap.
Pours black with moderate tan head.
Aromas of nuts and black coffee.
Flavors of same with a bit of ash and dry roasted malts/barley.

UPDATED: OCT 31, 2016 330ml Bottle. A nice fucken boost level offered considering this isnt an imperial porter or east euro commie Baltic equivalent. A nose of classy coffee that I cant really articulate its exact nuance ... Roasted, rich and creamy coffee malt complexity. A khaki head sits nicely above dark brown ... Drinks fine . Quite rich and smooth . Bags of roasted coffee . Not as complex to drink as the nose but a nice boost offered .

Bottled from Systembolaget
Black with a small, beige head. 
Roasted aroma with some chocolate and a lot of coffee-beans. 
Loads of chocolate and cold coffee in the flavour. Dry cocoa-powder.

Draught at Fermentoren.
Black colored with a medium sized beige head.
Sweet and roasted aroma of vanilla and chocolate with notes of coffee.
Sweet and roasted flavor of vanilla and chocolate.
Sweet and roasted finish.
Bottle. Pours a black color with a small off-white head. Has a roasted malty coffee aroma. Roasted malty coffee and chocolate flavor. Has a roasted malty coffee and chocolate finish.

Lukt: Kaffe og lakris.
Utseende: Sort.
Skum/kullsyre: Tynt skum.
Smak: Kaffe og nydelig mørk sjokolade og vanilje.
Hvor: WhatsBryne tasting hos Untapd Jostein.
Medium: [email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */, [email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */,4%, Nå[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */
Kommentar: Dessert de lux.
On tap at CBC Boston. Comes almost black with a small brown head. Aroma of chocolate, coffee, and malt. Taste is chocolate, roasted malt, coffee, and vanilla. Well made Porter. Tasty.
Bottle from systembolaget. Pours a dark brown colour beer with a small brown head. Roasted malt with coffee, cocoa, vanilla and some fruity notes. Dry finish

Flaska från SB. Opak ganska tjock närmast kolsvart vätska med medelhögt mörtbeige skum. Stor doft av kaffe som döljer nästan all annan doft. Även smaken är väldigt kaafedriven. Lätt syrlig med lite drag av kaffesump med en ganska besk avslutning. Aningen söt lakrits, vanilj, bitter choklad och mörk malt jämte kaffet. Trevlig.
Bottle from SB. Very dark brown with a small brown head. Malty and toasted tones. Malt, coffee, fruit, vanilla and hops. Medium to full body with a bitter / fruity finish.

Bottle. Black with thin foam ring. Aroma is vanilla, cocoa, coffee and some rasted. The aroma of this beer is very, very complex and nice. I give this one 10 in aroma score and its well worth it. Taste is a bit more thin, but includes much of the same but not so much vanilla and more roasted then the aroma.

330ml bottle. Pitch black with small brown film. Aroma of chocolate, coffee, roasted malts and slight soy sauce. Taste is initially sweet going over to bitter with chocolate, strong coffee and roasted malts. Medium, very smooth mouthfeel, light carbonation and sweet chocolaty aftertaste.
Flaska systembolaget. Svart kulör med guldbrunt skum. Doft av rostad malt, choklad och kaffe. Smak av det samma. Krämig choklad med kaffeton.

Bottle. Aroma is coffee, chocolate, vanilla, cocoa, hints of oak. Black, small light brown head. Medium sweetness, light bitter, taste is dark chocolate, coffee, vanilla, some dark fruits, some roasted notes. Full body, soft carbonation, long lingering sweet chocolate finish. Fantastic porter!
Bottle from Systembolaget. Black with a tan head. Aroma of coffee, roasted malt, vanilla and some chocolate. Similar taste. The body was medium and the mouthfeel was quite smooth.

Bottle from Vinmonopolet, Kvadrat. Pours black with a big creamy beige head. Aroma is more than inviting, loaded with coffee, roasted malts and some good sweet chocolate.Full bodied, creamy soft mouthfeel. Taste is light sweet, chocolate, coffee with cream, bitter finish, very good one.

Flaska. Mörkt brun, nästan svart, med ett snyggt beigt skum. Dofter av rostad malt, choklad och vanilj. Smakinslag av choklad, vanilj, trä, espresso och rostad malt. Lite väl hårt smaksatt med vanilj. Medelkropp. I avslutningen kommer en lätt, ytterst lätt, kryddighet.
Negro opaco y espuma beis. Aromas de chocolate, vainilla, café, tostados, cacao. Cuerpo medio con sabor intenso con en aroma y final de amargor tostado largo.

Lots of coffee, woody, roasty, vanilla, astringent, light berries, alcohol and cocoa.
Black colour, medium tan head, lacing.
Mid-sweet, big bite, salty, lots of vanilla, coffee and heavy roastiness, ABV evident.
Fullbodied, creamy feel, soft carbonation, long, roasty, sweet and warming finish.
Well done.

Black colored, thick, medium creamy dark tan head, nice lacing. Aroma is of coffee and coffee beans, some cocoa and vanilla. Taste is medium+ sweet malt, cocoa, earthy, vanilla and strong coffee with coffee beans, medium- cocoa and roasty bitterness, light alcohol, nice finish and aftertaste. Medium to full bodied, soft carbonation, creamy thick. Coffee-chococandy! Lovin it!
(bottle, Sir Williams Pub, Ljubljana)
Bottle @ home. Milky mouthfeel and taste of coffee, coffee again, liquorice, dark chocolate and burnt wood. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle: Black colour, with a nice Brown creamy head. Aroma is dominated of coffee, dark choclate, vanilla, rasins, dry bitternes. Flavor had a smouth creamy mouth feeling of coffee, vanilla, dark chcolate, sweet maltynes, medium body, short to medium coffee, dark chocolate, vanilla fruity finish.

Bottled, from Systembolaget.  Black, rich beige head. Vanilla dominates the nose, some espresso on a distance. Sweet with full body and dense, rounded mouthfeel. Sugar and vanilla dominates, some nice espresso and then perhaps some roasty malt. Warming finish with resiny bitterness and sugar burn. Too sweet and too much vanilla. Overall too flavoured.

Flaska från SB. Kolsvart, tjock vätska med krämigt mörk brunbeiget skum som lämnar en del rester längs kanterna. Fyllig doft av choklad, lakrits och snygg intensiv kaffeton. Även toffee, lite svarta vinbär och inlagda körsbär. Stor, riktigt krämig och gräddlen kropp. Stor i smaken med massor av sötsyrliga kaffetoner, pumpernickel, toffee och choklad. Går över i lite rökiga och charkiga toner. Grymt gott.
Bottled:Black with a thick head.Aroma is coffee, chocolate and some vanilla.Smooth mouth feel.Flavour is all about coffee leading to a warming alcohol finish.
@ Basunen 16-9-24: Stor doft av kaffe och vanilj. Det smakar ungefär lika med stora fylliga toner. Lång fin eftersmak.

Black color, small brown head. Lovely roasted aromas of malt and coffee with sweet chocolate. Taste does not match the aroma, sadly. Slight bitter coffee with milk chocolate and licorice that leads to a finish that feels a bit .. off.
Black with very thin brown head. Amazing aroma of coffee, vanilla and chocolate. Really well balanced taste with a lingering biterness. Very nice porter.

@ Havregatan 20160923. Bottle (330 ml) from Systembolaget. Roasted malty, lots of coffee, vanilla and cocoa notes, medium to full body with an oily texture. The finish is dry, bitter and roasted with coffee.
Flaska från SB. Svart med ljusbrunt skum. Kraftig kaffedoft, drar åt kaffesump. Mjölkig känsla. Bra kärv kaffesmak med inslag av choklad och lite mjölk.
Black beer with dark brown head. The aroma has notes of chocolate, a hint of vanilla, and roasted malt. The flavor is sweet with notes of roasted malt, and chocolate. Bitter finish.
330ml Bottle - Black with a tan head. Coffee, vanilla and roasted malt in the aroma. Vanilla, coffee and cocoa feature in the roasted and slightly sweet taste. Smooth and easy to drink for the abv.

How: Draught.
Where: Man in the Moon, Stockholm.
Appearance: Black colour with a beige head.
Aroma: Coffee, chocolate, caramel, liquorice.
Body: Medium body, low to medium carbonation.
Flavour: Coffee, chocolate, liquorice, some alcohol.
Bottle 0.33l at home, Nivala. Bottled 4APR16. BB 4APR17. Colour is almost black with very small brownish head. Aromas and flavors: Chocolate, dark chocolate, some coffee and roasted malts. Very nice.

(Draught at BrewDog Kungsholmen, Stockholm, 8 Sep 2016) Black colour with creamy, beige head. Malty, roasted nose with notes of fresh coffee, dark chocolate and black rye bread. Malty, roasted taste with black coffee, dark chocolate, tart berries, black rye bread and a generous coffee bitterness in the finish. More than medium body, with a touch of sweetness. Well balanced with a very fresh coffee character and a slight coffee acidity. Excellent beer.
medium body, velvety, lactose, very good coffee flavor, semi sweet, high drinkability
Bottle. Pours black. Aroma of coffee beans, roasted malts and dark chocolate. Rich smooth taste of roasted malts with plenty of bitterness. Good stuff.

(330ml bottle from boxbeers.dk) Pours black with a moderate tan head that fades without lace. Aroma has huge coffee bean presence, cacao, rich semi-sweet dark chocolate, earth, vanilla, muscovado, toasted grains and light floral notes. Flavour has coffee roasted with a lovely balance, floral and fruity apple-like notes, earth, slight ash, muscovado sweetness, toasted grain, vanilla, cacao. Finish has moderate bittering to counteract the sweetness and ends dry, toasted grain, unsweetened cacao, coffee beans, light floral and spicy notes. Fairly light-bodied with average carbonation. Resists being a secret imperial stout, feels unquestionably like a porter but still big on flavour. Attention paid to the coffee used and it pays off very admirably.
Aromat kakaowy, kawowy, palony, nutka wanilii i karmelu. Smak słodki, lekko gorzki, w smaku dużo kawy, kakao, paloności. Dobra rzecz.

[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */
Appearance: dark brown with ruby sparkling; brown head.
Aroma: vanilla, coffee, some chocolate, vague roasted malt.
Taste: coffee, chocolate vanilla, bittersweet.
Palate: smooth, medium body, low carbonation.
Overall: very nice.

Really dark beer with nice beige coloured head. Aroma has roasted malts, espresso coffee, vanilla, and cocoa. Taste has vanilla, espresso coffee, roasted malts and some chocolate sweetness. Full oily body and lowish carbonation.  ---Rated via Beer Buddy for Android

Dark brown, creamy creme brulee. Coffee, touch of wood, vanilla. Dapper syrup rich body. Very lucious, nice beer if you dont mind the sweetness. (33cl bottle from Saveur Bière, shared after Hapje Tapje)

Olajos, telt fekete, bézs színű habot fejlesztő főzet, melynek illatai kecsesek, nem túlontúl mélyek, visszafogott változatát adják a súlyosabb kávés specialitások aromáinak. Pörkölt, háncsos jegyeket visel magán, a háttérben egy vékonyabb vaníliaszál is meghúzódik, néhol bársonyosabb, néhol élesebb, komlós arculatot is mutatva. Kortyai krémesek, közepesen teltek, jóleső intenzitású pirított malátás alapokkal, némi földes réteggel, kávészemes szegéllyel. Nem a mélységek itala, de a porterek között kitűnik; izgalmas alkotás.

Holiday top-50 fun hunt #10. Guatemalan Coffee...pours black, thin with a brown head. Aroma of massive coffee beans, roasted and toasted malts, grain, cacaopowder, sugar. Taste of vanilla, like dessert sweetness, Dutch hopjesvla, coffee, quite sweet, slightly bitterness which is lovely, quite malty, dry, chocolate, roasted coffee beans, longlasting finish, however it could have used a thicker body, low carbo, great coffee beer !!!

On tap at the Buxton taphouse. Pours pitch black with a mocha head and has this wonderful rich milk chocolate aroma. Delicious chocolate syrup flavour, vanilla alcohol and slight espresso coffee. All perfectly balanced.
-From bottle, Edinburgh- Chocolate, vanilla, coffee and floral. Dry, smooth, sweet and roasty finish. WOW! Vanilla bomb!

Bottle from Rehills, Newcastle. Inky black with a thick head of tan foam. It has a rich, sweet milk chocolate, coffee and vanilla flavour followed by a creamy chocolate and bitter-sweet coffee finish. Excellent!

Bottle from Rehills of Jesmond. Mahogany with a nice beige head. Huge choclolate and coffee aroma. The taste is more chocolateand coffee with light spice. Very full flavoured. Perhaps a touch cloying after a while.

Bottle from Saveur-Biere.com - Color: deep dark black beer with no carbonation and small brown head. Smell: roasted malt, coffee domination and mocha balance. Sweet finish, vanilla notes and caramel. Taste: medium body with roasted malt balanced with coffee exposition. High mocha taste, chocolate finish with sweet vanilla hint. Very intensive, so much flavor. Impressive beer. Good attenuation. Aftertaste: roasted malt, mocha and vanilla.

pours black color, clear, with stable, lasting creamy light brown/beige head. Aroma: intense cacao, vanilla and coffee notes, pretty well balanced, supported with hints of bittersweet chocolate, cinnamon in the background. 
Flavor: Intense coffee (beans) flavor, supported with cacao, vanilla, roasted malts, hint of cinnamon...on the second half steps forward hop flavor, which takes on pine, some dark fruits. Finish is dry, slightly bitter and lingers in aftertaste. Body is medium to full, texture is soft, carbonation is low. For my point of view, this should be in category "porter". But overall: it is very well made beer.

330 ml. bottle. Bottled 04.04.2016. Very dark brown, disappearing mocha head. Nose is huge massive coffee beans, roasted coffee beans, low glue, roasted faintly vegetable coffee. Lots of coffee beans here. Taste is huge coffee beans, cold brew coffee, some cacao beans, sugar, lightly thin, faint vegetable coffee. Its a bit fizzy, it could have been thicker for me. Not bad at all, I would have loved it more if I were a bigger coffee fan, this is hugely on coffee. I could have used it thicker, it could have used a thicker body in my opinion. This big coffee & cacao nibs show is not bad as it is now. Massive, massive coffee.

Bottle from Oddbins Beer Shop, Blackheath. Black pour with a light tan head. Heavy coffee aroma with a splash of vanilla, black treacle and burnt sugars. Smooth dark coffee roast flavours with a hint of dark chocolate and smoke. Boozy mouthfeel. Throat warming tastiness.
Pours black with thin tan head. Aromas of coffee, malt and cocoa. Medium fine carbonation but very light mouth feel. Taste is dark chocolate, malt and finishes in dry, bitter coffee.
Great coffee and cacao aroma. The flavour is a creamy coffee porter, with a nice bitter finish.

Really dark brown color with mocha head. Aroma is sweet with roasted malt and vanilla. Taste starts also sweet with lots of vanilla, roasted malts, sugar and some chocolate. Finish is quite bitter and roasty with lingering coffee flavor. Medium body and carbonation with smooth mouthfeel. Overall its a really tasty porter with a sweet vanilla component, balanced out by a bitter, roasty coffee finish.

dense beige head. coffee coloured. aroma is coffee, confit, caramel, vanilla. taste like aroma, lots of liquorice, ash, a long and a bit of dry acrid finish. medium body and carbonation. bottle 33cl / thanks GlasgowTAD!

Bottle at home from ee-briaCold brewed coffee on aroma. Full bodied, thick, cocoa, vanilla, sweet coffee, ashy, fruity, full on coffee, very easy drinking, alcohol well integrated. A very nice base beer too, well balanced with enough dryness to counter the potential sweetness. Nice one.

On tap @ Man in the moon, Stockholm. Black body with a medium/low tan head. Sweet aromas of chocolate, vanilla & lactose. Flavor is more dry and roasted, with notes of coffee, dark chocolate & liquorice.

Appearance- pitch black, a small light brown head which leaves a foamy covering. Aroma- rich roasted coffee, dark malts, dark chocolate, hints of vanilla sweetness, but all about the coffee. Taste- smooth dark chocolate, dark Italian roasted coffee, sweet vanilla backbone, burnt toast, caramel and bready malt hints. Silky smooth mouthfeel. Good stuff.

Deep brown-black (>70 EBC) with a small tan head. Aromas of chocolate, cocoa, vanilla, roasted malt, oatmeal porridge and earthy tones develop. 
Fine perlage, light viscid/creamy texture with a pronounced body. Faint brisk roast malt sweetness with a solid vanilla-coffee astringency and bitterness. Harmonic light dry lasting finish.

Draught at Man In The Moon, Stockholm. Opaque black beer with a nice lasting beige head. Licorice and milk chocolate aroma, cocoa powder, ice coffee, espresso notes, caramel, some figs, dark chocolate, vanilla notes. Chocolate flavor, coffee, roast, cocoa powder, licorice, soot, some warming alcohol. Complex drinkable porter.

330ml bottle from Saveur-Biere. Pours pitch black with a smooth head. Aroma of lovely coffee beans, vanilla, cocoa, mild roastiness, chocolate and espresso, hints of mudcake. Taste is super smooth with loads of coffee, vanilla beans, cocoa nibs, dark chocolate and mild roastiness, hints of mudcake. Finish is smooth, slightly roasty and heavy with vanilla, coffee and cocoa nibs. Quite tasty and balanced.

UPDATED: JUN 5, 2016 330ml bottle from Saveur-Biere


Deep black colour with a tan medium head. Wow, great coffee and bourbon infused aroma. Flavour of chocolate, coffee, ash, caramel, bourbon and cacao. Great stuff!
Bottle. Quite good, lots of vanilla, cocoa, roast. Also considerable coffee. Nicely balanced flavour-wise.
Bottle. Dark brown/black colour, light beige head. Aroma roasted, coffee, espresso, chocolate, caramel. Taste os mostly coffee too, roasted, some cacao, hops. Roasted aftertaste. Vedy good.
Bottle kindly shared by MisoW, many thanks. Very dark brown color with medium off-white head. Strong coffee aroma. Taste, coffee, nuts, dark chocolate, Tasty.

Bottle from minutemat in EuroSwap 02/2016, many thanks. Pours dark brown color, beige head. Aroma of strong coffee, dark chocolate, roasted malt. Taste is medium bitter, medium sweet, chocolate, strong coffee, roasted malt, nuts.

Bottle kindly shared by MisoW, dark brown color, medium beige head. Aroma is malty, light roasty, vanilla, bourbon, wood, tobaccoo, cocoa. Taste is light roasty, solid malty, sweety, milky notes, cocoa, vanilla, bourbon, light coffee. Nice

Bottle 33cl , an oily dark beer with medium brown and creamy head. Nose is on cocoa powder, dark chocolate, some vegetable notes as well as licorice wood. Aroma is on a creamy dark chocolate, light chili notes, espresso notes, light metallic touch, the vegetable notes is on coffee beans sometimes this becomes on added chili. Smooth body, well balanced porter with nice mocha / chocolate powder notes.
Bottle from De Hopduvel. Dark brown/black colour, beige foam. Nose of espresso, roasted malts, dark chocolate and vanilla. Well balanced. Drinkable. Nice porter.

Lest vraiment joli ce nez .... Prégnant et pour autant pas vulgaire ... A lallure de la robe, on sattend un peu bêtement à une consistance en bouche porche dun Stout et cest donc très surpris quon découvre cette acidité franche en attaque. Un très joli café frappé ma fois. Sec et un peu raide, peut-être trop ? ... Un peu de mal à trouver le cacao qui se fait discret ou, amère, se cale juste derrière le café.

30/IV/16 - on tap @ Tilquin English Beer Festival - BB: n/a (2016-486) Thanks to the Belgian Ratebeer Crew (and Beerhunter111) for sharing todays beers!
Clear dark brown beer, small creamy beige head, unstable, non adhesive. Aroma: lots of coffee, mocha, caramel, sweet, lots of vanilla, sweet chocolate, more vanilla. MF: ok carbon, medium body. Taste: lots of coffee, very sweet, caramel, lots of vanilla, bitter hops. Aftertaste: cocoa powder, coffee, dry, very bitter, very roasted.

Bottle. Black beer with good light brown coloured head. The aroma is strongly bitter and coffee roasted, and the flavour is heavily roasted with a deep expresso coffee bitterness with some eventual mellowness at the end of a long finish. Overall a nice strongly flavoured stout.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Couleur noire forte mousse beige. Fort nez café torrefié, cacao, cremeux. Gout sec de café, épices, malt terreux, avec du chocolat un peu cremeux.
Corps onctueux. Fin café, épices, grillé. Nickel

Bottle from Hops & Crafts Exeter,pours black with a thick dark beige head,aroma fresh chocolate,coffee & feint hop fruit ,taste is complex ,chocolate ,coffee & vanilla ,dark malt, some roast & some sweet hop fruitiness ,the taste is intially sweet but i bitterness & dryness kicking in quickly ,long chocolatey ,roasted ,fruity bitter finish , surprising light bodied & drinkable ! Another top beer from Buxton ,well done!

Bottle from The Beerhive. Black body with a dense beige head. Good lacing. Aroma of Nutella, espresso, creamy chocolate, tiramisu and vanilla beans. Flavour of dark chocolate, coffee, roasted malt and hazelnut with a lingering peppery finish. Medium body with a smooth texture. Light fizz. This is absolutely packed full of flavour yet its still subtle and complex - no element is overdone in any way. A stunning beer.

UPDATED: FEB 23, 2017 butelka, warka do 4-04-2017. Ciemny braz, i piwa i piany (ladnej). Aromat to przede wszystkim wanilia, ale tez sporo kawy, czekolady, palonosci. Niemniej przez dominacje wanilii pierwszy lyk jest duzym zaskoczeniem, bo dosc wytrawny, dosc mocno kwaskowaty - az za mocno nieco... nie do konca az to pasuje do aromatu, ale jest fajne. srednio wysycony, srednio ciala, finisz nadal wytrawny i kwaskowaty, z kakaowymi, goryczkowymi posmakami. alkohol niezle schowany (choc nie do zera). dosc gladkie piwo. bdb+ i ciekaweTo piwo ma niecodzienna ceche: na zimno jest intensywniejsze w aromacie i smaku niz po ogrzaniu do temperatur okolo-pokojowychOcena potraktowana skryptem do przeliczania ocen (uzgodnienie UT/RB).

9th May 2016Bottleshare at Lancaster Gate. Thanks to the Hawaiian Pizza Boy. Almost clear deep amber beer, tidy pale tan head. Smooth semi dry palate, decent fine carbonation. Smooth dry malts, a little cream. Nice fruity coffee. Little dark chocolate. Mild earthy spice. Light dry finish. Rich and tasty.

[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ Takeover, Fermentoren, Copenhagen (10/05/2016) - pours black with a beige head. Aroma and taste is roasted malty, slight burnt dark malty notes, with chocolate, coffee, caramel, cocoa, dry roasted finish.

Very dark, initially with an off-white head, but not for long. Nose is very much led by coffee and cocoa, but with fruit lurking not far behind. Body is full and frothy. Fruit real!y comes through in the flavour, alongside the chocolate and a healthy dose of vanilla. Almost great, if anything maybe a bit tart.
From tap at Fermentoren. Hazy brown colour with a beige head. Aroma and flavour of berries, oak, acetone, sourness vinegar and tartness.

Draft. A black beer with a dark Brown head. The aroma has notes of chocolate, vanilla, and roasted malt. The flavor is sweet with notes of roasted malt, caramel, and chocolate, leading to a bitter finish.
From tap. Pours dark brown to black with a small brown head. Aroma is mild vanilla and roasted malty. Dark malty and roasted. Liqourice and roasted dark malty. Dry and roasted dry finish.

33cl bottle shared at Leightons May tasting. Sourced via Eebria. It pours a dark brown color with a medium beige head. Aroma is full of coffee with light vanilla and roasted wood. Taste is also full of freshly roasted coffee grains and vanilla. Medium bodied with good carbonation. Overall, fantastic coffee brew

Bottle share at Leightons, with thanks to Matteo. As Buxton Extra Porter Guatemalan Coffee, 7.4%. Opaque black, foamy brown head. Aroma is strong coffee, some charred pepper, dark chocolate liquer. Body is smooth, soft carbonation. Taste is dark chocolate, a little salty, filter coffee. Very good for style.

Bottle shared at Leightons place 09/05/2016. Many thanks to matteo for this one. A dark black coloured pour with a halo of mid tan head. Aroma is lovely, earthy choc, praline, coffee bean and coconut. Lovely. Flavour is composed of creme caramel, choc, bitter black , toasted coconut, coffee bean. Palate is semi sweet, rounded, moderate carbonation, medium roasted finish. Very good indeed.

Bottle thanks to MattyO. It pours black with a small tan head. The aroma is rich roast, big coffee character, prailine, mellow acidity, powdered cocoa and plum. The taste is smooth, bitter - sweet, chocolate, big coffee character, earth, tangy dark fruits, vanilla and jammy berry with a dry, roasted finish. Medium + body and fine carbonation. Crazy delicious.

Bottle shared in W2 - thanks to Matteo. Pours rich brown with a creamy, tan head. Good roasted malt nose, with massive coffee, scorched earth. Rich flavor, fairly sweet, with baking cocoa, oily coffee, earth, faint leather. Medium to full bodied with average carbonation. Bitter finish with more coffee and baking cocoa. Great stuff.

Bottle at Bespin, thanks to Matteo, 09/05/16.
Pitch black with a decent tan swirl.
Nose is big espresso roast, tirimasu, chocolate, light spice, charr.
Taste comprises sweet roast, vanilla, coffee beans, cocoa powder, light charr.
Medium bodied, fine carbonation, semi dyring close.
Solid coffee ooped prter.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: Bottle at home in garden, 8th May 16. Black, small white head, aroma is complex, bitter cocoa, high quality coffee. Taste is bitter coffee, lots of it, bitter chocolate, cocoa dust, slight vanilla. Dry never overly sweet and good to drink.
Bottle from Beer Gonzo, Coventry black colour with a thick tan head. Aroma milk chocolate, coffee, roasted cocoa, and malt. Taste is milk chocolate sweet., with a balanced bitter finish.

Roasted cacao, toasted malts, milk coffee, mocha milkshake. Hazy, very dark brown, small, creamy, beige head. Medium bitter. Bitters continue, but roasted cacao sweetness coming up, yet dry, milk coffee, mocha ice cream, dry, bitter finish, full bodied. This is an exceptional Porter, beautiful coffee and cacao, immensely complex. Bottle from the brewery (via Eebria), Buxton.

Bottle from Beerhive. Deep dark brown, big beige head that dissipates. Huge coffee and cocoa nose. Medium thin body, soft fizz. Milky chocolate shake and coffee. Vanilla and sweet cream. Bitter finish. Excellent.
Bottle at home. Pours black, nose is chocolate, roasted coffee, vanilla, taste is similar, smooth, chewy.

@ 2d Tilquin English Beer Festival+ Open doors Plus un café à la bière quune bière au café. Dégustation très déséquilibrée donc mais qui ravira les caféïnomanes comme moi. En tout point délicieuse: le nez exhale de fortes senteurs de café expresso fraîchement moulu épicé à la vanille accompagné dune senteur poudreuse de cacao avec un houblon herbacé aigrelet. Après un accord des saveurs à lattaque avec le nez, je reçois un maltage puissant qui livre n goût puissant de café au chocolat vanillé dans le gosier. La forte torréfaction du café rapproche ce Porter dun Stout  à cause de la saveur de malts brûlés. Le tout se terminant en beauté avec une amertume légèrement astringente voire aigrelette et un pointe citronnée sur une belle longueur.

Drinked @TilquinEnglishBeerFestival 16, on tap.

The freshness of a ice coffee, but with beer ! The aroma is vanilla and chocolate, and the taste is vanilla and chocolate, coffee.

I juste love it !

From Tap. Sehr dunkel braune Farbe, geringe beige Schaumkrone. Geruch extrem nach nach Kaffee, Vanille, frische Kaffee Bohnen. Geschmack süß röstmalzig, Milchkaffee, Schokolade, frische Kaffeebohnen, sehr gut.
Draught  No head left, deep dark brown beer. Coffee, coffeebeans, rather sweet. Cold coffee, bitterish,  Haagse Hopjes . Very slick to viscous, well-bodied. Not bad, too much coffee for my liking.

Bottle from Beermoth. Pours almost black, brown head. Nose has loads of delicious coffee aromas, sweet vanilla, cacao. Taste is vanilla, cocoa, coffee, decent bitterness and roast. Delicious coffee beer.

On keg.
Appearance - opaque black with a lovely fawn head. 
Nose - dark chocolate but then this is overwhelmed by the coffee. 
Taste - more general mocha notes. Deep and luscious. 
Palate - medium to full bodied with a creamy texture and a long and very balanced finish. 
Overall - Im not a big fan of coffee in beer but this is great.
Draft at Tilquin English Beerfestival. Coffee, chocolate, bitter, great stuff.

A black beer, a head is small and brown. Aroma is dominated by strong but honest and tasteful roasted coffee, nice balancing and sweet chocolate, hint of liquirice and vanilla. Taste has vanilla, coffee, dark chocolate and roastiness, just great. Medium+ bodied, smooth and pleasant palate. The body could be also much stronger. This is the beer for coffee lovers. Great beer.

Bottle. Beer Central, Sheffield. Clear, dark brown. Film and halo of sticky, tan head. Nose has sweet cocoa powder. Fruity coffee bean. Caramel. Chocolate truffle. Vanilla. Smells lovely. Taste is nicely balanced, chocolate sweet, and earthy, woody, coffee bean bitter. Smooth palate. Suitably rich, and full. Finishes earthy, coffee bean bitter. Ridiculously drinkable, smooth, tasty dessert beer.
UPDATED: APR 28, 2016 Keg at hanging bat.. Dark roast chocolate malts nose.. Dark chocolate roast.. Mellow chocolate roast dry chocolate roast... Little too cold... Light roast... Big malts

Keg at The Buxton Tap House. A black colour with a medium tan head. Aroma of roasted malts, fresh coffee, chocolate, some caramel, slight nuts and subtle fudge. Taste of fresh coffee, chocolate, some roasted malts, slight nuts, a little brown sugar and subtle dark fruits. Medium bodied and soft carbonation. A long, chocolatey, roasted coffee bitterness in the finish. An incredible coffee porter. Big roasted coffee and chocolate aroma and flavour but just so well balanced with a little nuttiness and subtle fruits to be really drinkable. Lovely.

Bottle, The Offie, Leicester. Rich coffee with bittersweet dark chocolate. Earthy with light bonfire smoke and herbal liquorice. Underlying burnt toffee. Oily palate with hints of soy sauce. Sticky on the lips. Roasted bitterness. Very good.

33cl shared bottle in Duporth from Bitter Virtue, Southampton. Nose is roasty, woody. Body is pitch black, head is very small, fully diminishing, fair lacing. Aroma is dark roasted coffee , dark chocolate, smoked old wood. Light sweet, heavy roasty bitter. Finish is medium lasting roasty heavy bitter, later also hoppy. Medium body, thin texture, soft carbonation. Nice dessert beer, bit heavy due to bitterness, great one.

Pours a shade below opaque black with a large and active brown head which promptly recedes. Aroma of coffee fills the room as soon as the cap is off; cocoa, hazelnut and a whiff of berries are all in the mix. Taste is bitter coffee, bitter cocoa, cocoa sweet, berry acidity, hazelnut, liquorice. Medium-to-full body with an oily feel.

Bottle. Nose is coco, coffee beans, vanilla, roast, hint of smoke, filter coffee. Taste is milk chocolate, filter coffee, slight fruity blackcurrant note, hazelnut, leading to roast, coffee, slight sour note, then a dry coffee finish. Further taste, brings out the vanilla and more of the chocolate notes, and just a light herbal hop note. 

Very nice porter, that the coffee does not overwhelm.

Pours black with a low tan head. Aromas of coffee, chocolate, lactose, roasted malt, roasted nuts, brown sugar. Taste is roasted with some fruitiness and chocolate tones. Mouthfeel is quite creamy with low carbonation.
Pours deep brown to black with flat tan head. Aroma of milk chocolate, vanilla, mild coffee. Taste is rich coffee bitter with a chocolate sweet finish. Medium bodied with soft carbonation.

Pours dark brown with low tanned head 
Aromas of coffee, vanilla, milk chocolate, hints of almonds
Taste has notes of coffee, milk chocolate, vanilla, brown sugar

Bottle from Cotteridge Wines; dark brown pour with a creamy tan head, rich quality coffee aroma, taste has great coffee taste with a light bitter edge, dark chocolate, roast malts, great tasting, rich impy porter.

Bottle from Eebria, consumed at home Thursday 14th April 2016   Pours black with a glint of chestnut at the rim, offering some clarity, light beige rim, coffee (lots on the nose). Oodles of chewy coffee in the mouth, a late bitter, roasty bite. Its quite fruity and tangy, lovely but wanes just a little. A6 A4 T7 P4 Ov13 3.4

330ml bottle from the brewery via eebria. Pours black with a thick tan head. Aromas of roasted coffee and chocolate. Taste is more chocolate and roast coffee. Light boozy, biscuit. Long roasted bitter finish.

Keg at Tilt, Birmingham. Poured almost black with a round tan head. The aroma is chocolate, sweet caramel, roasted malt. The flavour is moderate sweet with a rich chocolate fudge cake, coffee, light alcohol hop bitter palate. Medium bodied with soft carbonation. A superb ale. Almost a black IPA in some ways but plenty of chocolate and coffee. I could drink this all night long.

330ml bottle (bottled 5 days previous). Thanks to Katie & Chris at Has Bean for the freebie! Pours dark, good tan head. Aroma is lots of coffee, milk chocolate, caramel, vanilla. Taste is rich and layered, initial coffee with vanilla, caramel and chocolate nudging their way through on the finish. Delicious beer.

Keg @ Bishops Arms Hornsgatan. Pitch black, creamy mocha head, leaving rich thick lacing around the glass. Deep coffee aroma, fresh roasted coffee beans, vanilla, chocolate and cocoa. Velvet smooth mouthfeel. Rich coffee taste with pleasant vanilla sweetness, milk chocolate, dry and roasted cocoa bitterness. Tasty and rich.
